keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Ahmad Walid Rashidi lost his father, a brother and a leg to the Taliban and thought he would take his revenge against another group of militants: the Islamic State.

headline.print_headline: Victim of Extremists Comes to Understand Siren Song of the Islamic State
headline.main: Victim of Extremists Comes to Understand the Siren Song of ISIS

snippet: Ahmad Walid Rashidi lost his father, a brother and a leg to the Taliban and thought he would take his revenge against another group of militants: the Islamic State.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Ahmad Walid Rashidi, Afghan medical student in Denmark whose background allows him to offer insight as to why young European Muslims are drawn to Islamic extremist groups; says he was imprisoned, tortured and nearly executed by Islamic State yet still found himself drawn to group's rhetoric, which addresses many issues including historical injustices of Western colonialism in Middle East.
